m_DescList: Linguistic expressions often have multiple forms:
I drank a glass of water.
A glass of water was drunk by me.
We need to match different sentence patterns that meet the requirements.
<color=#05C3BA>( | )</color> represents multiple options for a subexpression
<color=#05C3BA>|</color> is the vertical line near Enter key (Shift+\ on QWERTY keyboard)

<color=#05C3BA>(</color><color=#AB2800>Java </color><color=#05C3BA>| </color><color=#AB2800>Python</color><color=#05C3BA>)</color> matches <color=#3c3cff>This game is neither written in Java nor in Python, It has nothing to do with whether Java and Python are easy to learn or not.</color>:
<color=#666666>This game is neither written in </color><color=#3c3cff>Java</color><color=#666666> nor in Python, It has nothing to do with whether Java and Python are easy to learn or not.</color>
<color=#666666>This game is neither written in Java nor in </color><color=#3c3cff>Python</color><color=#666666>, It has nothing to do with whether Java and Python are easy to learn or not.</color>
<color=#666666>This game is neither written in Java nor in Python, It has nothing to do with whether </color><color=#3c3cff>Java</color><color=#666666> and Python are easy to learn or not. </color>
<color=#666666>This game is neither written in Java nor in Python, It has nothing to do with whether Java and</color> <color=#3c3cff>Python</color><color=#666666> are easy to learn or not.</color>
"X" for first player, "O" for second, " " for empty
Now, expect to count the total number of pieces (the number of X or O).
Construct a regular expression to pass all test cases.
